entry.title: Taproot NACK
entry.summary: In an email exchange on the bitcoin-dev mailing list, LORD HIS EXCELLENCY JAMES HRMH expressed concerns about increased privacy in Bitcoin and the potential for it to lead to government bans. However, another member of the group pointed out that Taproot, a new upgrade to Bitcoin, does not enable the kind of privacy features that would raise these concerns. The email exchange also raised questions about LORD HIS EXCELLENCY JAMES HRMH's link to a bitcoin mixer in his signature, which could be seen as contradictory to his stated concerns. The writer asked for clarification on his association with the mixer and requested that he disclose any relationships when publicly discussing Bitcoin transaction privacy. LORD HIS EXCELLENCY JAMES HRMH did not address the mixer directly but withdrew his previous objection to Taproot and emphasized the importance of maintaining transparency in Bitcoin transactions. He also provided contact information and links to various projects, including willtech.com.au, go-overt.com, and LinkedIn.
